description: cmd/vet: delete; it now lives in the go.tools subrepo

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

Should the dir be "govet", so installing it with the go tool will use the
correct binary name?
indeed it was. i had a CL to hold that hostage but the CL is gone. i'm having a bad hg day.

I don't see what this has to do with the CL at hand, but the dir (in the
other repo) should continue to be vet, and whatever we use to build the
full distribution (go tool or some other script) should know where to put
it.

Russ

https://codereview.appspot.com/9496043/diff/1/test/bench/shootout/timing.log
File test/bench/shootout/timing.log (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/9496043/diff/1/test/bench/shootout/timing.log#newcode6
test/bench/shootout/timing.log:6: # sudo apt-get install libpcre3-dev
This seems like an unrelated change.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, dsymonds@golang.org, rsc@golang.org, iant@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Now there is a new subrepo, can someone with permissions please
redeploy build.golang.org to cover it.

On Sat, May 18, 2013 at 6:33 AM,  <r@golang.org> wrote:
> indeed it was. i had a CL to hold that hostage but the CL is gone. i'm
> having a bad hg day.
>
>
>
> https://codereview.appspot.com/9496043/
>
